intro: Salsola contrariifolia, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Eurasia and North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, prostrate stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant is highly drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to harsh, saline environments. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its invasive potential in some areas. Salsola contrariifolia plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitats.
